sagex.phoenix.fanart

Class FanartUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • sagex.phoenix.fanart.FanartUtil

  • public class FanartUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Collection of Useful Functions for dealing with the Central and Local Fanart Locations.

    This library should remain portable in that it can be used from within sagetv or in an external library.

    • Method Detail

      • createSafeTitle

        public static java.lang.String createSafeTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Cleans a Title for use in the Fanart Folder, by applying the following regex to the title to remove unwanted chars. 

         [\\\\/:\\*?\"<>|]+
        Parameters:
        title - Title to clean
        Returns:
        Cleaned title

                                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata)
        Deprecated. use getCentralFanartArtifact(MediaType, String, MediaArtifactType, String, String, Map)

      • getCentralFanartArtifact

        public static java.io.File getCentralFanartArtifact(MediaType mediaType,
                                                    java.lang.String mediaTitle,
                                                    MediaArtifactType artifactType,
                                                    java.lang.String artifactTitle,
                                                    java.lang.String centralFolder,
                                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata)
        Get a Fanart Artifact for a Given Title from the Central Fanart Folder. This can also be used when inserting fanart into the central folder. For example, it will return a file. You test if the file exists and if it does not exist then you can write to the file to create the new file.

        Note, that mediaType, mediaTitle, artifactType, and artifactTitle can all be null. The path will be made of up the non-null items that are passed.

        ie, a fanart path consists of the following 

         CENTRAL_FOLDER[/mediaType][/mediaTitle][/artifactType][/artifactTitle]/[artifactTitle.jpg|mediaTitle.jpg]

        For this reason, you can request different types of fanart that are are not natively supported by the system, by omitting mediaType and artifactType. for example, you can call, (null, "Genres", null, "Family") and it would return a folder like CENTRAL_FOLDER/Genres/Family/Family.jpg

        Parameters:
        mediaType - MediaType (TV, Movie, etc)
        mediaTitle - fanart title identifier (it will be cleaned)
        artifactType - MediaArtifactType Fanart Artifact Type (Banner, Background, etc)
        artifactTitle - artifact title, usually used with Actor artifact type to provide the actor name
        centralFolder - Central Folder Location
        metadata - any extra metadata about the object, ie, SeasonNumber, etc.
        Returns:
        a fanart artifact file, which may not exist.

        public static java.lang.String getEpisodeFilename(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata)

      • getCentralFanartDir

        public static java.io.File getCentralFanartDir(MediaType mediaType,
                                               java.lang.String mediaTitle,
                                               MediaArtifactType artifactType,

                                               java.lang.String centralFolder,
                                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata)
        Return the CentralFanart Dir for the given media types and artifacts. Use by getCentralFanartArtifact(MediaType, String, MediaArtifactType, String, String, Map) and getCentalFanartArtifacts(MediaType, String, MediaArtifactType, String, String, Map)
        Parameters:
        mediaType -
        mediaTitle -
        artifactType -
        artifactTitle -
        centralFolder -
        metadata -
        Returns:

      • getCentalFanartArtifacts

        public static java.io.File[] getCentalFanartArtifacts(MediaType mediaType,
                                                      java.lang.String mediaTitle,
                                                      MediaArtifactType artifactType,
                                                      java.lang.String artifactTitle,
                                                      java.lang.String centralFolder,
                                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata)
        Get an Array of Fanart Artifacts for a Given Title from the Central Fanart Folder
        Parameters:
        mediaType - MediaType (TV, Movie, etc)
        mediaTitle - fanart title identifier (it will be cleaned)
        artifactType - MediaArtifactType Fanart Artifact Type (Banner, Background, etc)
        artifactTitle - artifact title (usually only used with actor name for actor fanart)
        centralFolder - Central Folder Location
        Returns:
        a String array of fanart artifacts or null if it's not found.

      • resolveMediaFile

        public static java.io.File resolveMediaFile(java.io.File f)
        Given Media File, return the "real" file that is the media file. For normal files, this will return itself. For DVD Files, it will return the DVD Parent dir. ie, for a VIDEO_TS dvd dir, it will return the parent of that dir.
        Parameters:
        f -
        Returns:

        Returns:
